intro: Villadia elongata, commonly known as the slender bladdernut, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is characterized by its elongated, cylindrical stems and alternate, ovate leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Villadia elongata is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and can be found in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
